24500.name: Citadel Gates - The Threshold
24500.description:
Two immense gates of black iron stand before you, their surfaces crawling
with shadow that moves independently of any light source. The air here is
wrong — too still, too cold, and sounds arrive a half-second late, as if
reality itself is lagging. Beyond the gates, darkness waits like a living thing.

zone_mechanic.clone_message: Your shadow peels away from the floor and attacks!
zone_mechanic.corruption_message: Darkness seeps into your soul. Shadow corruption: {level}%

north.description: Through the gates into the citadel.

south.description: The gates lead back to the highlands.

24501.name: Shadow Vestibule
24501.description:
The vestibule beyond the gates is bathed in a sourceless grey light that
casts no shadows — because the shadows here move on their own. Dark tendrils
creep along the walls like ivy, and the floor reflects nothing, as if made
of solidified darkness. Three corridors branch from here.

east.description: A narrow passage to the east.

24502.name: Hall of Flickering Torches
24502.description:
Iron sconces line the walls, each holding a torch that burns with pale
lavender flame. The light they cast is wrong — it creates more shadows
than it dispels, and the shadows move when you're not looking directly
at them. Still, the light provides some comfort in this forsaken place.

zone_mechanic.message: The torchlight pushes back the creeping darkness within you.

24503.name: Whispering Gallery
24503.description:
This curved gallery amplifies every sound into eerie whispers. The walls
are covered in faded murals depicting the fall of some ancient civilization
into shadow. As you watch, the figures in the paintings seem to move,
their painted mouths forming silent screams. The whispers grow louder.

24504.name: Corridor of Dread
24504.description:
The corridor stretches impossibly long, far longer than the exterior of the
citadel should allow. The walls pulse like a heartbeat, and your footsteps
echo back to you changed — heavier, more numerous, as if something walks
beside you just out of sight. The temperature drops with each step.

24505.name: Mirror Chamber
24505.description:
Floor-to-ceiling mirrors line every wall of this hexagonal chamber. But
the reflections are wrong. They move a fraction of a second after you do.
Sometimes they smile when you don't. Sometimes they don't move at all,
just staring back with expressions of pure malice. One mirror shows a
door that doesn't exist in the real room.

zone_mechanic.hint: One reflection shows a door that isn't there. Touch the mirror to pass through.

24506.name: Shadow Armory
24506.description:
Weapons forged of solidified shadow hang on the walls — swords that drink
light, shields that absorb hope. The armory is attended by silent shadow
servants who move with mechanical precision, maintaining weapons that
have never been used by mortal hands.

24507.name: The Umbral Crossroads
24507.description:
Four passages meet at this junction, marked by a black obelisk that
hovers three feet above the floor, slowly rotating. Shadow runes crawl
across its surface, rearranging themselves into warnings in dead languages.
The darkness here is almost tangible — you can feel it pressing against
your skin like cold fingers.

24508.name: Void Antechamber
24508.description:
The walls here have dissolved into pure void — not darkness, but the
complete absence of anything. Stars that aren't stars drift in the
nothingness beyond the narrow stone walkway. Step off the path and you
fall forever. The walkway leads north toward a massive set of doors
pulsing with shadow energy.

24509.name: Nightmare Kennels
24509.description:
Cages of shadow-wrought iron line this chamber, most standing open.
Claw marks gouge the stone floors, and the air reeks of something
predatory. Whatever was kept here has been released — or has escaped.
Distant howling echoes through the halls, drawing closer.

24510.name: Hall of Eclipsed Light
24510.description:
Once, this grand hall was illuminated by a magnificent chandelier of
crystal and gold. Now the crystals have turned black, and the chandelier
radiates darkness instead of light. Inverted shadows — bright spots in
the darkness — mark where light once fell. The effect is deeply unsettling.

zone_mechanic.message: The inverted light here paradoxically soothes your corruption.

24511.name: Feeding Pit
24511.description:
A deep pit has been carved into the center of this room, its edges slick
with dark ichor. Chains dangle into the darkness below, some still bearing
the remains of unfortunate prisoners. The nightmare beasts were fed here.
The stench of death and shadow is overwhelming.

24512.name: Shadow Library
24512.description:
Bookshelves stretch into impossible heights, filled with tomes bound in
shadow-leather. The books write themselves — dark knowledge flowing onto
pages that weren't blank a moment ago. Reading them too long causes the
words to crawl off the page and into your mind. Some knowledge is better
left unlearned.

zone_mechanic.hint: One book describes a hidden passage. Read it to reveal the exit.

24513.name: Spiral Staircase of Shadows
24513.description:
A tight spiral staircase winds upward through the tower. Each step is a
different shade of darkness — some solid, some disturbingly yielding
underfoot. Shadow hands reach from the walls, grasping at ankles and
wrists. The ascent feels like climbing through a nightmare.

24514.name: Corruption Chamber
24514.description:
This chamber is the source of the shadow corruption that infests the citadel.
A massive crystal of pure darkness hovers at the center, pulsing with
malevolent energy. Tendrils of shadow reach from it to the walls, ceiling,
and floor, pumping corruption through the citadel like a dark heart.

zone_mechanic.message: The corruption crystal floods your soul with darkness!

24515.name: Mirror Realm - Inverted Chamber
24515.description:
You stepped through the mirror and everything is reversed. The room is
identical to the one you left, but wrong — text reads backwards, gravity
feels slightly off, and your reflection in the mirrors here shows the
real room you came from. A passage leads deeper into this inverted space.

24516.name: Tower of Whispers
24516.description:
The upper tower opens into a circular chamber where the whispers of a
thousand damned souls create a constant, maddening drone. Wind howls
through narrow arrow slits, and through them you can see nothing but
void — no sky, no ground, just infinite darkness stretching forever.

24517.name: Shadow Forge
24517.description:
An impossibly cold forge dominates this chamber, its anvil made of condensed
nightmares. Shadow-smiths hammer at weapons that scream when struck.
The forge burns with black fire that consumes light rather than fuel.
Weapons created here drink the souls of those they slay.

24518.name: Mirror Realm - Throne of Reflections
24518.description:
In this inverted throne room, a mirror-image throne sits upon a ceiling
that is also a floor. Reality folds in on itself here. Sitting on the
throne is a perfect copy of Shadow Lord Malachar — or perhaps this is
the real one, and the other is the copy. The mirror realm holds its own
treasures for those brave enough to claim them.

24519.name: Sanctum of Light
24519.description:
Against all odds, a pocket of pure light exists within the citadel. A
crystalline orb hovers here, radiating warm golden light that holds the
shadows at bay. This was once the chamber of the citadel's original
master, before Malachar corrupted everything. The light here can cleanse
even deep shadow corruption.

zone_mechanic.message: The pure light washes through you, burning away the shadow corruption!

24520.name: Hidden Observatory
24520.description:
A secret room above the library, accessed only by those who read the
right tome. A massive telescope made of shadow-glass points into the
void. Through it, you can see other planes of existence — worlds of
fire, ice, and pure chaos swirling in the darkness between realities.

north.description: A secret passage to the north.

24521.name: Approach to the Throne
24521.description:
A grand corridor lined with pillars of solidified shadow leads to massive
double doors ahead. The doors are carved with scenes of the Shadow Lord's
conquest — worlds consumed by darkness, stars extinguished, gods brought
low. The power emanating from beyond is staggering.

24522.name: Void Gallery
24522.description:
The walls of this gallery have been replaced entirely by windows into the
void. Cosmic horrors drift past — entities of impossible geometry and
sickening grace. They press against the barriers, testing for weakness.
The gallery serves as both a trophy hall and a warning.

24523.name: Shadow Guard Barracks
24523.description:
Malachar's elite guard rest here between shifts. Shadow-forged armor
stands on racks, and weapons hum with dark energy. The guards themselves
are barely distinguishable from the shadows they serve — half-formed
things of darkness given purpose and malice.

24524.name: Soul Prison
24524.description:
Hundreds of crystallized souls float in this chamber, each trapped in a
prism of shadow energy. Their faces are frozen in expressions of eternal
agony. These are the source of Malachar's power — each soul fuels his
dark magic. Some prisms flicker weakly, their occupants nearly consumed.

24525.name: Antechamber of the Shadow Throne
24525.description:
The final chamber before the throne room. The air is so thick with shadow
energy that it's nearly solid. Dark lightning crackles between the pillars.
The temperature has dropped below freezing, yet no frost forms — the cold
is metaphysical, the chill of absolute darkness reaching into your soul.

24526.name: Ritual Chamber
24526.description:
A pentagram of shadow energy is etched into the floor, its lines still
glowing with residual power. This is where Malachar performs his darkest
rituals — soul consumption, plane-tearing, and worse. Arcane instruments
of unspeakable purpose line the walls. The air tastes of despair.

24527.name: The Throne of Shadows
24527.description:
The heart of Shadowspire Citadel. A throne of pure crystallized darkness
hovers above a platform of void-stone. Shadow Lord Malachar sits upon it,
his form shifting between solid and ethereal. The room itself is alive —
walls of living shadow pulse and writhe, and the ceiling opens into an
abyss of stars that have been extinguished. Reality bends around the
throne, and the very concept of light seems like a distant memory.
This is where hope comes to die.

24528.name: Shadow Dungeon Cells
24528.description:
Rows of cells carved from shadow-stone line this underground level.
The prisoners here are not bound by chains but by shadow tendrils that
feed on their fear. Most cells are empty now, their occupants long since
consumed. A few hold gibbering wrecks of what were once powerful beings.

24529.name: Chamber of Echoes
24529.description:
Every sound in this room repeats endlessly, layering upon itself until
the cacophony becomes maddening. Your own heartbeat thunders back at
you amplified a thousandfold. The shadows here dance to the rhythm of
the echoes, forming shapes that almost — but not quite — resolve into
recognizable forms.

24501.name: shadow stalker
24501.long_desc: A Shadow Stalker slides across the floor, barely visible in the darkness.
24501.description:
More absence than presence, the Shadow Stalker is a tear in reality shaped
like a predator. It moves without sound, strikes without warning, and
fades back into darkness between heartbeats. Only its eyes are visible —
twin points of cold, hungry light.

24502.name: void walker
24502.long_desc: A Void Walker phases in and out of reality, crackling with dark energy.
24502.description:
This entity exists simultaneously in multiple planes, its form flickering
between solid and transparent. Where it walks, reality cracks and splinters.
It wields the void itself as a weapon, and its touch can send pieces of
you to dimensions from which there is no return.

24503.name: mirror wraith
24503.long_desc: A Mirror Wraith stares at you with YOUR face, twisted in hatred.
24503.description:
The Mirror Wraith is a horrifying reflection — it copies the appearance
of whoever looks at it, but twisted and corrupted. Your face, but with
black void where the eyes should be. Your body, but wrong, jointed
backwards, moving in ways that make your mind recoil.

24504.name: nightmare beast
24504.long_desc: A Nightmare Beast prowls the shadows, its form constantly shifting.
24504.description:
Born from the collective nightmares of a thousand sleeping minds, this
beast has no fixed form. It shifts constantly — now a wolf with too many
legs, now a spider with human hands, now something that defies description
entirely. The only constant is its hunger and its hatred of the waking world.

24505.name: Shadow Lord Malachar
24505.long_desc: SHADOW LORD MALACHAR sits upon his throne of darkness, regarding you with contempt.
24505.description:
Shadow Lord Malachar was once a mortal wizard who sought to master the
void between worlds. He succeeded beyond his wildest nightmares. Now more
shadow than man, he exists as the living nexus of all darkness. His form
is regal and terrible — a king of shadows wearing a crown of extinct
stars. His voice is the silence between heartbeats, and his gaze is the
darkness that waits at the end of all things. To face him is to face
the death of light itself.

24501.name: Shadowweave Cloak
24501.room_desc: A cloak woven from living shadow pools on the ground here.

24502.name: Blade of the Void
24502.room_desc: A sword of absolute darkness lies here, drinking the light around it.

24503.name: Amulet of Light
24503.room_desc: A brilliant golden amulet radiates pure light here.
